message.content:
cs.CY, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.HC 

This paper discusses the behavior of individuals in online communities and the factors that contribute to trolling behavior. It involves the analysis of data from online news discussion communities, which falls under the category of social and information sciences (cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC). The study also involves an experiment simulating an online discussion, which could be categorized under human-computer interaction (cs.HC). Finally, the paper proposes trigger mechanisms for trolling behavior, which could be categorized under cybernetics (cs.CY).
